column2: Some say Orunmila is the second in command of creation, and he is known as a wise master of divination. Rather than the diloggún, he divines by casting okuelé chain and ikín nuts across a carved divining board, and he is also skilled in medicine.

Some say [santeria.GetHighGodName] is the second in command of creation, and he is known as a wise master of divination. Rather than the cowrie shells, he divines by casting nut shells and animal hairs across a carved divining board, and he is also skilled in medicine.
The Obá Babalawo of the Regla de Ifá.

column2: the Divine Will
Tire Machèt
This character has mastered the obscure art of tire machèt.
Machete Training
As you are a member of §Y[GetReglaDeIfaSocietyName]§!, you can undergo rigorous training to achieve a new ability on the battlefield.
You begin your training regimen.
Perform Scrying
column3: Prédire l'avenir
column4: Zukunft deuten

column2: As a member of [From.Society.GetName], §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§! may choose to turn to the mystical art of divination in an attempt to foretell the future.
column3: En tant que membre [From.Get_du_Society], [From.Get_le_TitledFirstNameJ] peut choisir de se tourner vers l'art mystique de la divination dans une tentative de prédire l'avenir.
column4: Als Mitglied des "[From.Society.GetName]"-Zirkels kann §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§! sich der mystischen Kunst der Prophezeiung bedienen, um zu versuchen, die Zukunft vorherzusagen.
column6: Como miembro de [From.Society.GetName], §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§! puede optar a convertirse al arte místico de la adivinación para intentar predecir el futuro.

column2: Brew Happiness Potion
As a [From.GetSocietyRank] of [From.Society.GetName], §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§! can brew a potion to raise low spirits.
column3: En tant qu[From.Get_e_SocietyRank] [From.Get_du_Society], [From.Get_le_TitledFirstNameJ] peut préparer un breuvage magique qui chasse la déprime.
column4: Als [From.GetSocietyRank] des "[From.Society.GetName]"-Zirkels kann §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§! einen Trank brauen, der die Gemüter hebt.
column6: Como [From.GetSocietyRank] de [From.Society.GetName], §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§! puede elaborar una poción para levantar el ánimo.

column2: Create Fetish
Use your deep knowledge of the soul to create a fetish that is imbued with spiritual power.
Begin the process of creating a fetish based on your specific religion.
Enables §Gright-clicking§! on your character's portrait in order to turn to the mystical art of divination in an attempt to foretell the future.
column3: Permet de se tourner vers l'art mystique de la divination dans une tentative de prédire l'avenir.\n(Faites un clic droit sur votre portrait)
column4: Ermöglicht einen §GRechtsklick§! auf das Porträt Eures Charakters, um einen Versuch zur Vorhersage der Zukunft zu unternehmen.
column6: Activa el §Gclic con el botón secundario§! en el retrato de tu personaje para que se convierta al arte místico de la adivinación e intente predecir el futuro.

column2: Enables §Gright-clicking§! the portrait of any §RDepressed§! or §RStressed§! character in your court, in order to make them a potion that raises their spirits, in exchange for §Y[From.Society.GetCurrency]§!.
column3: Permet de préparer un breuvage magique qui chasse les mauvaises pensées pour les personnages de la Cour en §Rdépression§! ou ayant de l'§Ranxiété§! en échange de §Y[From.Society.GetCurrency]§!.\n(Faites un clic droit sur leurs portraits)
column4: Ermöglicht einen §GRechtsklick§! auf das Porträt einer §Rdeprimierten§! oder §Rgestressten§! Person an Eurem Hof, um gegen einen Preis von §Y[From.Society.GetCurrency]§! für diese einen Trank zuzubereiten, der ihr Gemüt hebt.
column6: Activa el §Gclic con el botón secundario§! en el retrato de cualquier personaje §Rdeprimido§! o §Restresado§! de tu corte para prepararles una poción que les levante el ánimo a cambio de §Y[From.Society.GetCurrency]§!.

column2: Enables a decision in the §YIntrigue§! menu that gives you a unique martial trait.
Enables a decision in the §YIntrigue§! menu that gives you a spiritual restriction on certain behaviors.
Enables a decision in the §YIntrigue§! menu for rulers in §Y[GetReglaDeIfaSocietyName]§! to create special artifacts that are imbued with mystical properties.
As an initiate in §Y[GetReglaDeIfaSocietyName]§!, you are sworn to a vow of celibacy. This restriction will be lifted if you manage to advance to the next rank.
Invite Holy Ascetic
column3: Inviter un saint ascétique
column4: Heiligen Asketen einladen

column2: Invite a holy ascetic belonging to [Root.Society.GetName] to join your court.
column3: Inviter un saint ascétique membre [Root.Get_du_Society] à rejoindre votre Cour.
column4: Ladet einen heiligen Asketen, der dem "[Root.Society.GetName]"-Zirkel angehört, dazu ein, sich an Euren Hof zu gesellen.
column6: Invitas a un/a santo/a asceta de [Root.Society.GetName] a unirse a tu corte.

column2: A holy ascetic will soon appear at the court of §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§!.\n
column3: Un saint ascétique apparaîtra bientôt à la Cour [Root.Get_du_TitledFirstNameJ].\n
column4: Am Hof von §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! wird bald ein heiliger Asket erscheinen.\n
column6: Pronto aparecerá un/a santo/a asceta en la corte de §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§!.\n

column2: Receive Ewo
As a member of [GetReglaDeIfaSocietyName], you have the ability to receive an ewo, a restriction on your behavior that will make you more connected to the divine.
As a member of [GetReglaDeIfaSocietyName], you have the ability to receive an ewo, a restriction on your behavior that will make you more connected to the divine.
You begin the process of receiving an ewo.

[From.GetMOGreeting], [Root.GetTitledFirstName]

We are delighted by your decision to join our ranks as an initiate, [Root.GetTitle]. Together we shall strive for the betterment of ourselves and our fellow [Root.GetReligiousPerson]s by following [From.GetMOCode].

[From.GetMOFarewell],
Signed, [From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
column3:
[From.GetMOGreeting], [Root.GetTitledFirstName] 

Nous sommes ravis de votre décision de rejoindre nos rangs en tant que membre lai[Root.Get_E]. Ensemble, nous nous efforcerons de nous dépasser, nous et nos camarades [Root.GetReligiousPerson]s, en respectant [From.GetMOCode].

[From.GetMOFarewell],
Signé, [From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
column4:
[From.GetMOGreeting], [Root.GetTitledFirstName],
wir sind von Eurer Entscheidung, Euch als Laienmitglied unseren Reihen anzuschließen, entzückt. Lasst uns gemeinsam durch [From.GetMOCodedieden] nach unserer eigenen Verbesserung und der Verbesserung [Root.GetReligiousPerson] Menschen streben.

[From.GetMOFarewell]
[From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
column6:
[From.GetMOGreeting], [Root.GetTitledFirstName]

Nos complace tu decisión de unirte a nosotros, [Root.GetTitle]. Juntos lucharemos por superarnos a nosotros mismos y a nuestros compañeros [From.GetTrueReligionGroupPersons], guiados por la [From.GetMOCode].

[From.GetMOFarewell].
Firmado: [From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]

column2: Thank you, [From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName].

I brewed the potion just like the divine recipe dictated. Mere seconds after it passed my lips a wave of pleasurable sensations rolled over me! While the peak of my bliss was short-lived, that first rush must have washed away the dispiriting darkness that has plagued me for so long.
Praise [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]!

'I do not mean to meddle, [Root.GetTitledFirstName], but you do not seem to be well,' says [From.GetTitledFirstName], concern tinting [From.GetHerHis] voice. 'I have brewed a sacred potion that can raise low spirits and bring about happiness.' [From.GetSheHeCap] offers me a flask containing an unidentifiable liquid.
I am willing to give it a try, [From.GetFirstName].
column3: Je suis disposé[Root.Get_E] à faire un essai, [From.GetFirstName].
column4: Ich bin bereit, es zu probieren, [From.GetFirstName].

column2: Drink the potion. §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§! has assured you there will be no side effects...
column3: Vous buvez le breuvage magique. [From.Get_Le_TitledFirstNameJ] vous a assuré qu'il n'y aurait pas d'effets secondaires...
column4: Kostet von dem Trank. §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§! hat Euch versichert, dass er keine Nebenwirkungen haben wird...
column6: Bebe la poción. §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§! te ha asegurado que no tiene efectos secundarios...

column2: What is that vile concoction? Black magic? I will take my chances.
Refuse to drink the potion.
column3: Vous refusez de boire le breuvage magique.
column4: Weigert Euch, von dem Trank zu kosten.

column2: I brewed the potion just like the divine recipe dictated. [From.GetTitledFirstName] gratefully accepted my help and as soon as [From.GetSheHe] drank my concoction, I could see a change in [From.GetHerHim]. Now the light has returned to [From.GetHerHis] eyes!
I am glad I could be of assistance, [From.GetFirstName].

For a while I felt like nothing could extinguish the renewed sense of joy and purpose I gained after drinking the potion. It seems as if I was mistaken. Life and duty wears one down and I am no exception. There is nothing more, no great secret to uncover. Just toil and anguish, every day until my last.
column3: J'ai pensé durant un temps que rien ne pourrait éteindre le sentiment retrouvé de joie et d'ambition acquis depuis la consommation du breuvage magique. Il semble que je me sois trompé[Root.Get_E]. La vie et les responsabilités comportent des difficultés, et je ne suis pas une exception. Il n'y a rien de plus, aucun grand secret à découvrir. Simplement de la fatigue et de l'angoisse, chaque jour jusqu'à mon dernier.
column4: Eine Weile kam es mir so vor, als könne nichts das durch den Trank gewonnene erneuerte Gefühl von Freude und Erfüllung auslöschen. Das Leben und die Pflicht zermürben einen aber nun mal - da bin ich keine Ausnahme. Es gibt nichts weiter, kein großes Geheimnis, das es zu entschleiern lohnt. Nur Mühsal und Verzweiflung, Tag für Tag, bis an mein Lebensende.
column6: Por un momento sentí como si nada pudiese extinguir la renovada sensación de alegría y resolución que obtuve después de beber la poción. Parece que me equivoqué. La vida y el deber lo desgastan a uno, y yo no soy una excepción. Ya no hay nada más. No quedan secretos por descubrir. No hay más que trabajo y angustia hasta el último de mis días.

column2: I must have gotten the recipe wrong somehow...

As I begin to partake of the sacrament, I feel nothing at first. Yet it only takes a few moments before I begin to see beyond... Distorted images of the world, the past and the future. I take a deep breath, to attune myself to what I am looking for...
I want to know about battles to come.
I want to know where my relationships will lead.
I want to know what will happen to me as [Root.GetTitle].
The sacrament's power fluctuates. I breathe and focus deeply. It takes time, maybe hours, as time becomes fleeting.\nThen I see it. A fierce battle! I can almost hear the clanking of swords.
It takes a minute, but after a while I am certain of it: I see a lion! Or... No, it's a woman. With the head of a lion!
I concentrate for a long time, breathing deeply. I almost have time to doubt myself, but then I see it: a shadow, then two. It looks like a fire, and a sword.
I see... nothing. I feel tired.

At first, all I the water shows me is the reflection of the ceiling. I shake my head. I have to look beyond the material world! I close my eyes, and when I open them again, I see it clearly.\nA bed of flowers, and an urn.
column3: Au début, tout ce que l'eau me montre, c'est le reflet du plafond. Je secoue la tête. Je dois regarder au-delà du monde matériel ! Je ferme les yeux, et quand je les ouvre de nouveau, je les vois clairement.\nUn lit de fleurs et une urne.
column4: Zuerst sehe ich in dem Wasser nichts als das Spiegelbild des Himmels. Ich schüttele den Kopf. Ich muss in den Bereich jenseits des Materiellen blicken! Ich schließe meine Augen und als ich sie wieder öffne, sehe ich es klar und deutlich.\nEin Blumenbeet, eine Urne.
column6: Al principio, el agua solo me muestra el reflejo del techo. Sacudo la cabeza. ¡Debo mirar más allá del mundo físico! Cierro los ojos, y cuando vuelvo a abrirlos, lo veo con claridad.\nUna cama de flores y una urna.

column2: I am at first not sure what to make of the strange shape. Maybe I am imagining it, or maybe it is a shadow. Does it matter? I see it clearly: a familiar silhouette, standing under a moon.
I see strange patterns... No, wait, a bunch of triangles!
There is just smoke... Or is it...? Yes, I see a forest. A vast forest!
I see a storm. I can almost hear it! Oh, it is actually raining.\n\n... But I still see a thunderstorm.
Marvelous! This is clearly a good omen!
column3: Merveilleux ! C'est clairement un bon présage !
column4: Wunderbar! Das ist eindeutig ein gutes Omen!

column2: Damnation! This is clearly a bad omen.
column3: Enfer et damnation ! C'est clairement un mauvais présage !
column4: Verdammt noch mal! Das ist eindeutig ein schlechtes Omen!
column6: ¡Maldición! No cabe duda de que es un mal presagio.

column2: As an initiate in [GetReglaDeIfaSocietyName], I am expected to become skillful in the art of tire machèt. However, it is an obscure art that can take weeks to become competent at...
I am ready to learn.
You begin learning the art of tire machèt.
You took to your studies readily, impressing even your tutors. Soon, you began to surpass even then. You have indisputably mastered the art of tire machèt.
It took some time, but you eventually became skilled at the art of tire machèt. Your tutors have unanimously agreed that your training is complete.
It took more time than usual, but you managed to become competent at tire machèt. Your tutors, impressed with your perserverence, have deemed your training complete.
It took an incredibly long time, but, somehow, you managed to learn tire machèt. The same tutors who nearly abandoned you have now decided that your training is complete.
I am a true fencer!
Your tutor defeats you again. "Not bad," he says. "If there ever existed a typical student, it would be you. Keep at it and you will surely learn."
Your tutor defeats you once again. "Your progress is slow, but steady. Keep practicing, and eventually you may be able to match me."
Your tutor defeats you yet again. "Your movements are predictable, and your blows are weak. If you do not redouble your efforts, you will never learn."
I will train again tonight.
I hope he is right...
I must not give up!
Your training continues.
You have decided to create a fetish - an object imbued with the power of the divine. What shall you create?
I will create an iron hammer, to honor Ogún.
I will create an iron bow and arrow, to honor Ochosi.
I will create an iron chalice, to honor Osún.
I will create a Nkisi imbued with the power of the sky.
I will create a Nkisi imbued with the power of the earth.
I will create a Nkondi to defend me from evil.
I will create a powerful gris-gris amulet.
I will create a drapo servis, a great banner to honor the divine.
I will create a doll, to represent a particular loa.
I will create a grand chalice, to partake of the sacrament with.
I will create a formal dress to honor Jah.
I will create a steel drum, to make divinely-inspired music.
I will create a statue of Maria Lionza.
I will create a statue of Guaicaipuro.
I will create a statue of Felipe.
As you create your hammer, you must come to a decision regarding the material. Should you use newly-forged steel, or steel from the distant past?
Old metal is rarer, and therefore more respected!
You use old metal.
Newly-forged steel would please Ogún more.
You use new metal.
As you create your bow and arrow, you must come to a decision regarding the material. Should you use newly-forged steel, or steel from the distant past?
Old metal is rarer, and therefore more respected!
You use old metal.
Newly-forged steel would please Ochosi more.
You use new metal.
As you create your chalice, you must come to a decision regarding the material. Should you use newly-forged steel, or steel from the distant past?
Old metal is rarer, and therefore more respected!
You use old metal.
Newly-forged steel would please Osún more.
You use new metal.
After much work, you have finally finished creating your iron hammer. Ogún will surely be pleased by your effort!
I am proud of my work.
After much work, you have finally finished creating your iron bow and arrow. Ochosi will surely be pleased by your effort!
After much work, you have finally finished creating your iron chalice. Osún will surely be pleased by your effort!
As you create your above Nkisi, you must come to a decision regarding the materials used. Will you use animal parts, or minerals and vegetables?
Animal parts are more expensive, but more potent.
You procure animal parts.
Minerals and vegetables are easier to gather.
You procure minerals and vegetables.
As you create your below Nkisi, you must come to a decision regarding the materials used. Will you use animal parts, or minerals and vegetables?
As you create your Nkondi, you must come to a decision regarding the materials used. Will you use animal parts, or minerals and vegetables?
After much work, you have finally created your above Nkisi. You will surely be more in tune with the spirits of the sky.
After much work, you have finally created your below Nkisi. You will surely be more in tune with the spirits of the earth.
After much work, you have finally created your Nkondi. You will surely be better protected from malevolent spirits.
As you create your gris-gris, you must come to a decision regarding its purpose. Will it defend you, or will it bring misfortune upon your foes?
I will strike fear into the hearts of my enemies!
Your gris-gris will use the best defense - offense.
I merely seek protection from others.
Your gris-gris will defend you from curses.
As you create your drapo servis, you must come to a decision regarding its appearance. Will it be grand and elaborate, or simple?
An elaborate design will surely impress others!
You use an elaborate design.
A less elaborate design shows deference to the loa.
You use a less elaborate design.
As you create your loa idol, you must come to a decision regarding its material. Will it use clay, or will it use cloth?
Clay will better retain the will of the loa.
A cloth idol will do.
After much work, you have finally created your gris-gris. You will surely be better protected from malevolent spirits.
After much work, you have finally created your drapo servis. You have surely found favor with the loa.
After much work, you have finally created your simple idol. The loa will surely come to inhabit it.
As you create your grand chalice, you must come to a decision regarding its material. Should you use ivory or wood?
Ivory is more prestigious.
You use ivory.
Everyone knows wood is better...
You use wood.
As you create your dashiki, you must come to a decision regarding its appearance. Should it be purple and lavender in color, or blue?
Purple is the color of royalty!
You make it purple.
Blue is more humble.
You make it blue.
As you create your steel drum, you must come to a decision regarding the material. Should you use newly-forged steel, or steel from the distant past?
Only old metal can truly create the sound I desire.
You use old metal.
New sounds require new steel.
You use new metal.
After much work, you have finally created your grand chalice. Partaking of the sacrament has never been this enjoyable!
After much work, you have finally created your dashiki. You will be better able to praise Jah if you wear the proper clothing.
After much work, you have finally created your steel drum. Now, you must begin creating some music...
As you create your statue, you must come to a decision regarding its material. Should it be made of marble, or stone?
Marble will seem much more impressive.
You use marble.
Local stone is the best option.
You use stone.
After much work, you have finally created your statue. Maria Lionza will surely be pleased!
After much work, you have finally created your statue. Guaicaipuro will surely be pleased!
After much work, you have finally created your statue. Felipe will surely be pleased!

[From.GetMOGreeting], [Root.GetTitledFirstName]

I feel as though you must hold a feast dedicated to [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] as soon as you can. This will bring people together so that they may honor the Divine.

[From.GetMOFarewell],
Signed, [From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]

[From.GetMOGreeting], [Root.GetTitledFirstName]

I have received word that you have held a feast dedicated to the Divine. Excellent work!

[From.GetMOFarewell],
Signed, [From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
Thank you!

[From.GetMOGreeting], [Root.GetTitledFirstName]

In order to truly appreciate our lives, we must remember what it is like to make do without luxury. I would like you to receive an ewo at your earliest convenience.

[From.GetMOFarewell],
Signed, [From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
The preparations have been made, and you have said your prayers. The time has come for [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] to reveal what your ewo shall be.
Have mercy on me, [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]!
Your ewo is revealed to you - from now on, you must adhere to strict restrictions on your diet. This will surely be taxing...
I will do as you wish, [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].
Your ewo is revealed to you - from now on, you must strictly avoid consuming alcohol. This will surely be taxing...
Your ewo is revealed to you - from now on, you must dress in the most plain and simple fashion possible. This will surely be taxing...
Your ewo is revealed to you - from now on, you must abstain from all sexual activities. This will surely be taxing...
Your ewo is revealed to you - from now on, you must avoid spending your time in leisure as much as you can. This will surely be taxing...
Diet Ewo
This character has receieved a divinely-ordained restriction on their diet.
Alcohol Ewo
This character has receieved a divinely-ordained restriction on drinking alcohol.
Dress Ewo
This character has receieved a divinely-ordained restriction on their way of dress.
Sex Ewo
This character has receieved a divinely-ordained restriction on sexual activities.
Leisure Ewo
This character has receieved a divinely-ordained restriction on leisure activities.

[From.GetMOGreeting], [Root.GetTitledFirstName]

I have received word that you have received an ewo. I am pleased with your diligence, and wish you luck in adhering to these restrictions.

[From.GetMOFarewell],
Signed, [From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
I will need it...
You have been deprived of your favorite foods, and you seem to grow weaker by the day. This ewo is causing you a great deal of stress...
This is too much!
Your dietary restrictions have forced you to eat less often, which seems to be doing you good. Perhaps this is [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]'s way of helping you...
Praise [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]!
You have been deprived of all drink, and you have become less able to deal with the pressures of rule. This ewo is causing you a great deal of stress...
It was difficult doing without drink at first, but you feel more energized than you have in a long time. Perhaps this is [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]'s way of helping you...
Your new dress code often makes you look out of place, and you feel that your subjects have less respect for you. This ewo is causing you a great deal of stress...
Your new dress code has made you realize that one's actions matter more than one's appearance. Perhaps this is [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]'s way of helping you...
Your newfound abstinence has clouded your judgment. You lay awake for hours at night, which leads you to feel exhausted during the day. This ewo is causing you a great deal of stress...
Your abstinence has made you less beholden to your base impulses, and you feel as though you are better off for it. Perhaps this is [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]'s way of helping you...
Your inability to truly relax has amplified the pressures of rule, and made you irritiable around others. This ewo is causing you a great deal of stress...
Your ewo has inspired you to throw yourself into the administration of your realm, making you a more effective ruler. Perhaps this is [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]'s way of helping you...
Your ewo is selected...
Iron Hammer of Ogún
This ceremonial hammer is made of the finest ancient steel.
Iron Hammer of Ogún
This ceremonial hammer is made of locally sourced, newly-forged steel.
Iron Bow of Ochosi
This ceremonial bow and arrow is made of the finest ancient steel.
Iron Bow of Ochosi
This ceremonial bow and arrow is made of locally sourced, newly-forged steel.
Iron Chalice of Osún
This ceremonial chalice is made of the finest ancient steel.
Iron Chalice of Osún
This ceremonial chalice is made of locally sourced, newly-forged steel.
Above Nkisi
This nkisi was made with spritually potent animal parts.
Above Nkisi
This nkisi was made with spritually potent minerals and vegetables.
Below Nkisi
This nkisi was made with spritually potent animal parts.
Below Nkisi
This nkisi was made with spritually potent minerals and vegetables.
Nkondi
This nkondi was made with spritually potent animal parts.
Nkondi
This nkondi was made with spritually potent minerals and vegetables.
Gris-Gris Pouch
This gris-gris pouch is made to bring misfortune to your foes.
Gris-Gris Pouch
This gris-gris pouch is made to defend you from the curses of your foes.
Drapo Servis
This drapo servis has an elaborate design, which impresses those who look upon it.
Drapo Servis
This drapo servis has a simple design, which indicates humility towards the loas.
Voodoo Doll
This idol of a loa is made from clay, and is said to contain the very spirit of a loa.
Voodoo Doll
This idol of a loa is made from cloth, and is said to contain the very spirit of a loa.
Grand Chalice
This ivory chalice is used for partaking the holy Rasta sacrament.
Grand Chalice
This wooden chalice is used for partaking the holy Rasta sacrament.
Dashiki

Hold a Feast
Holding feasts in honor of the Divine is an ancient tradition in Regla de Ifá. Doing so is a great way to both honor the Divine and form connections with others.
To complete this mission, §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! must take the §YHold a Feast§! decision in the Intrigue menu.
To complete this mission, §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! must take the §YReceive Ewo§! decision in the Intrigue menu.
Receive Ewo
Members of Regla de Ifá may be called to receive an ewo, or a spiritual restriction on their behavior. Receiving and adhering to an ewo is said to be good for one's soul.
To complete this mission, §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! must take the §YReceive Ewo§! decision in the Intrigue menu.
